links.title: René Arnoux: "Despite his limp, the man in the un..."
links.text: Despite his limp, the man in the uniform moves with efficient grace. His motions are measured and precise.

links.title: Gaston Martin: "The jolly-looking man in the checke..."
links.text: The jolly-looking man in the checkered jacket moves lazily. Like a giant tomcat stretched out in the sun...

links.title: Gaston Martin: "...then suddenly he leans forward a..."
links.text: ...then suddenly he leans forward and uses the 0-end of the measuring tape to nudge his opponent's balls further from the small brown sphere in the pit. As he does this, he complains about his back.

links.title: René Arnoux: "Apparently oblivious to his partner..."
links.text: Apparently oblivious to his partner's treachery, the uniformed man grabs a ball and takes aim again.

links.title: You: "That's none of my concern. [Discard..."
links.text: That's none of my concern. [Discard thought.]
